paragraphs.text: Is it just me?

8332a916f0c3.title: Proto tools like UXPin or Justinmind always show the 4 borders and have a checkbox that enables…

paragraphs.text: Proto tools like UXPin or Justinmind always show the 4 borders and have a checkbox that enables/disables singular edition. Same amount of clicks but you avoid the panel height changing for the 2 options…
paragraphs.name: 099d

33176f95aeea.title: Haha, I feel the same way. I sent Bohemian Coding a feature request asking just for this!

paragraphs.text: Haha, I feel the same way. I sent Bohemian Coding a feature request asking just for this!
paragraphs.name: dc03

paragraphs.text: UXchange
paragraphs.name: cae6

paragraphs.text: Have you ever tried the scissors tool in Sketch? It gets you 90% of what you’re doing here. You just won’t have:
paragraphs.name: c093

paragraphs.text: Multiple colored borders (at least I’ve never tried that)
Control over the border position. But I always find center to be the most reliable position anyhow.
paragraphs.name: 4e71

virtuals.subtitle: Have you ever tried the scissors tool in Sketch? It gets you 90% of what you’re doing here. You just won’t have:

content.subtitle: Have you ever tried the scissors tool in Sketch? It gets you 90% of what you’re doing here. You just won’t have:

paragraphs.text: Make the plugin!

92025da307f5.title: But in my opinion, there is rare of time using 2 borders with common corner.

paragraphs.text: But in my opinion, there is rare of time using 2 borders with common corner. Normally we just use one border on only one side.
Yes please!

85c0cae1ed51.title: Great work ! I want this feature in Sketch too !

paragraphs.text: Great work ! I want this feature in Sketch too !
paragraphs.name: b04e

paragraphs.text: I like your switch state solution it’s a clever way to handle the current UI and the split border function. I noticed that in the split mode you cannot add several borders, and it’s logic because in CSS you can have only one border.
paragraphs.name: 8c5b

virtuals.subtitle: I like your switch state solution it’s a clever way to handle the current UI and the split border function. I noticed that in the split…

paragraphs.text: I vote for the 2nd option, as its using CSS way. Thanks for the write up!
paragraphs.name: b8cb

paragraphs.text: Can you share this plugin?

2c7088a39c0d.title: I was so excited to download the plugin until I realized it’s only a design project.

paragraphs.text: I was so excited to download the plugin until I realized it’s only a design project. Nevertheless, this is something that should be supported by Sketch. Thanks for sharing :)
paragraphs.name: 98d7

5b27bafe3edd.title: Yup, this right here is the problem with single platform proprietary software.

paragraphs.text: Yup, this right here is the problem with single platform proprietary software.
I appreciate what Sketch has brought to the design community, but if they keep on this path they’re going to walk the same road as Adobe.
paragraphs.name: 78bd

virtuals.subtitle: I appreciate what Sketch has brought to the design community, but if they keep on this path they’re going to walk the same road as Adobe.

content.subtitle: I appreciate what Sketch has brought to the design community, but if they keep on this path they’re going to walk the same road as Adobe.

1c8b03be7254.title: Yeah, I used that Inner Shadow trick before, but then sketch still shows a hairline on both sides…

paragraphs.text: Yeah, I used that Inner Shadow trick before, but then sketch still shows a hairline on both sides of the square. I couldn’t use it to present my designs.
Make this a plugin. I’m sure you’re a smart fella.
paragraphs.name: 69b4

virtuals.subtitle: Make this a plugin. I’m sure you’re a smart fella.

content.subtitle: Make this a plugin. I’m sure you’re a smart fella.

paragraphs.text: Well done!
paragraphs.name: 7c44

paragraphs.text: Cool post! I also wrote an article talking about some of the missing features on sketch. I haven't got the need of using the border in just one side yet, but I think it's very well pointed out. The cool thing is you did an interface example that would solve the problem as mentioned, well done!

11678a52d718.title: I think this is a great project idea!

9f48991c78ad.title: Would love to hear Bohemian’s thoughts on effort required to implement this.

paragraphs.text: Would love to hear Bohemian’s thoughts on effort required to implement this. Seems like a low priority, asks the tool to be Dreamweaver, and breaks the polygon model.

d206a5c9d40e.title: XD has the same problem but the use of solid shadow is the solution.

paragraphs.text: XD has the same problem but the use of solid shadow is the solution. Maybe someone will build a plug-in on Git or Adobe will add this feature during its Beta stage. I still use AI as my go to software when Sketch and XD are missing features.

88b6bae1e0cc.title: I get it; you want a quick way to build the CSS visually.

paragraphs.text: I get it; you want a quick way to build the CSS visually. I would say, though, that if you’re exporting CSS straight out of Sketch to be implemented in a project you’re going to be implementing bloated, non-DRY code.

5ef0ef6be9cf.name: Russell Wyatt
5ef0ef6be9cf.bio: Greetings, I am a Virginia based designer enhancing the way people experience and interact with all things design. By providing engaging solutions through authenticity, integrity and creativity, I am able to create true value within projects. I believe “VALUE” is the key component in building the relationship between individuals and products. No matter what they may be. Through my work I have a passion to change peoples lives. I strive to create a better tomorrow. Together a real difference can be made. It only takes "ONE" courageous action to create a rippling affect of change. I hope value will motivate, inspire and provide actionable insights to help businesses and the society move forward in the coming future. Let us create together!
